Package model

Class VideoGame

java.lang.Object
model.VideoGame
public class VideoGame extends Object
This class contains most of the methods of the video game functionality. It contains the objects of the player and level classes.

  • Method Details

    • setResolution

      public void setResolution(int resolution)
      setResolution: This method allows to set the resolution that the video game will have.
      Parameters:
      resolution - : int: Integer that represents the resolution options that the video game has.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      getWidth: This method returns the width of the resolution that the video game will have.
      Returns:
      width: int: Width of the video game resolution.

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      getLength: This method returns the length of the resolution that the video game will have.
      Returns:
      length: int: Length of the video game resolution.

    • getLevels

      public Level[] getLevels()
      getLevels: This method returns the objects of the array of levels inside the video game.
      Returns:
      levels: Level[]: Objects of the array of levels.

    • addPlayer

      public String addPlayer(Player player)
      addPlayer: This method allows to add players to the array of players within the video game, if the player does not yet exist or if there is still space available.
      Parameters:
      player - : Player: Player already created to be added.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Confirmation message if it was added or not.

    • addEnemyToALevel

      public String addEnemyToALevel(Enemy enemy, int levelId)
      addEnemyToALevel: This method allows to add an enemy to a level if space is available.
      Parameters:
      enemy - : Enemy: Enemy already created to be added.
      levelId - : int: Id of the level to which the enemy is to be added.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Confirmation message if the enemy was added or not.

    • confirmTypeOfEnemy

      public boolean confirmTypeOfEnemy(String enemyType)
      confirmTypeOfEnemy: This method checks if the type of enemy entered matches any of those allowed by the video game.
      Parameters:
      type - : String: Type of enemy entered by the user.
      Returns:
      isFound: boolean: Confirmation status if the type entered matches or does not match any of the video game.

    • addTreasureToALevel

      public String addTreasureToALevel(Treasure treasure, int levelId, int numberOfTreasures)
      addTreasureToALevel: This method allows to add a treasure to a level if space is available. In addition, the user can add several copies of the same treasure created.
      Parameters:
      treasure - : Treasure: Treasure already created to be added.
      levelId - : int: Id of the level to which the enemy is to be added.
      numberOfTreasures - : int: Number of copies of the same treasure to be added.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Confirmation message if the treasure or the amount of treasure was added.

    • addNameOfTreasure

      public void addNameOfTreasure(String treasureName)
      addNameOfTreasure: This method allows you to add non-repeated treasure names to an array. This method is used to find the most repeated treasure in the video game.
      Parameters:
      treasureName - : String: Treasure name to be added in case it is not repeated.

    • setScoreOfPlayer

      public String setScoreOfPlayer(String nickname, int score)
      setScoreOfPlayer: This method allows to change the score of a player, if the player exists.
      Parameters:
      nickname - : String: Nickname of the player to change the score.
      score - : int: New score that the player will have.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Confirmation message if the score was changed or if the player does not exist to change the score.

    • levelUpForPlayer

      public String levelUpForPlayer(String nickname, int levelId)
      levelUpForPlayer: This method allows to level up a player, if the player and the level exist.
      Parameters:
      nickname - : String: Player's nickname to level up.
      levelId - : int: Id of the level to raise the player.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Confirmation message if the player could be leveled up or if neither the player nor the level exists.

    • reportTreasuresAndEnemies

      public String reportTreasuresAndEnemies(int levelId)
      reportTreasureAndEnemies: This method searches for and returns enemies and treasures within a level.
      Parameters:
      levelId - : int: Id of the level where treasures and enemies will be searched.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Message with treasures and enemies inside the level.

    • reportQuantityOfATreasure

      public int reportQuantityOfATreasure(String treasureName)
      reportQuantityOfATreasure: This method counts and returns the amount of treasure found within the video game.
      Parameters:
      treasureName - : String: Name the treasure to count its amount in the video game.
      Returns:
      quantityOfTreasure: int: Amount found of the treasure sought.

    • reportQuantityOfAnEnemy

      public int reportQuantityOfAnEnemy(String enemyType)
      reportQuantityOfAnEnemy: This method counts and returns the number of enemy encountered based on its type within the video game.
      Parameters:
      enemyType - : Enemy type to count the amount within the video game.
      Returns:
      quantityOfEnemy: Quantity found of the type of enemy sought.

    • reportMostRepeatedTreasure

      public String reportMostRepeatedTreasure()
      reportMostRepeatedTreasure: This method looks for the most repeated treasure within the video game. For this, it makes use of an array of the names of the non-repeated treasures to compare with each treasure in each level.
      Returns:
      treasureNames[posMostRepeatedTreasure]: String: Name of the treasure that is repeated most often in the video game.

    • reportEnemyWithTheHighestScore

      public String reportEnemyWithTheHighestScore()
      reportEnemyWithTheHighestScore: This method returns the highest scoring enemy and its level within the video game. For this, it uses an array of the highest scoring enemies within each level, and then compares them with each other.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Message that returns the highest scoring enemy and its level within the video game, or returns that there are no enemies within the video game, if so.

    • calculateNumberOfConsonantsInEnemyNames

      public String calculateNumberOfConsonantsInEnemyNames()
      calculateNumberOfConsonantsInEnemyNames: This method counts and returns the consonants of the names of all enemies in the video game. For this, an array of type char is used to count letter by letter.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Message that returns the number of consonants of the names of all enemies in the video game.

    • topPlayers

      public String topPlayers()
      topPlayers: This method organizes players within the array of players in descending order according to their score.
      Returns:
      msj: String: Message that returns the array of players organized with their names and score, in descending order according to the score, or returns that there are no players inside the video game in case there are.

    • searchLevelById

      public int searchLevelById(int levelId)
      searchLevelById: This method allows to search for a level by its Id.
      Parameters:
      levelId - : int: Id of the level to be searched.
      Returns:
      pos: int: Position of the level within the array of levels.

    • searchPlayerByNickname

      public int searchPlayerByNickname(String nickname)
      searchPlayerByNickname: This method allows to search for a player by his/her nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - : String: Nickname of the player to search.
      Returns:
      pos: int: Position of the player within the array of players.
